meanings.definition: Defeated in a vote by having a smaller number of votes.
meanings.sent1: The outvoted team graciously accepted the loss.
meanings.sent2: The outvoted candidate congratulated the winner.
meanings.sent3: The outvoted group decided to celebrate their effort instead.
meanings.sent4: The outvoted proposal quietly faded into the background.
meanings.sent5: The outvoted idea lingered in the minds of the participants.

meanings.definition: To defeat in a vote by having a larger number of votes.
meanings.sent1: She outvoted her friends to choose the movie they would watch.
meanings.sent2: The committee outvoted the suggestion for a new policy.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully outvoted each other on where to go for dinner.
meanings.sent4: His determination outvoted any doubts he had about the project.
meanings.sent5: The loud cheers outvoted the disappointed sighs in the room.
